13:15.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Green under pressure when dead-heating at Chelmsford 4 days ago (1m); penalty demands more
runners.name: Aneirins Sword
runners.spotlight: Wandered around under pressure when dead-heating at Chelmsford on his handicap debut four days ago (1m); open to further progress but a 6lb penalty asks a stiff question.

runners.comment: C&D win last month and finished a good third back here last week; high on the list
runners.name: Snaafy
runners.spotlight: C&D win last month and he ran another solid race when third here last week; looks a solid contender off the same mark.

runners.comment: Improved to win a Lingfield novice (1m) three weeks ago; more to come now handicapping
runners.name: Roserunner
runners.spotlight: Well held in fifth on his Kempton debut but he improved significantly to win a Lingfield novice (1m) three weeks ago; that form has been franked and he moves into handicaps with some potential.

runners.comment: Second on nursery debut two months ago (6f); unexposed but stamina for 8.6f not assured
runners.name: My Champion
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify favouritism when second on his nursery debut at Newcastle 60 days ago (6f) but it still represented an improved performance; should have more to offer but this is a big step up in distance and his sire's progeny have a modest strike-rate over 7f+.

runners.comment: Improved to win Newcastle nursery (1m) in November; open to further progress; solid claims
runners.name: Alfa Patisserie
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on her maiden/novice form when winning a 1m nursery (Popty Ping second) at Newcastle seven weeks ago; better off with her reopposing rival today and she remains capable of better.

runners.comment: Put in her place by Alfa Patisserie in November; has improved since but perhaps not enough
runners.name: Popty Ping
runners.spotlight: Put in her place by Alfa Patisserie at Newcastle in November; she has improved since but perhaps not sufficiently to turn the tables on her old rival on 2lb worse terms.

runners.comment: Potential improver now upped in trip for her nursery debut but others look stronger
runners.name: Karismas Angel
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three 7f maiden/novice events for fillies since October; possible improver now upped in trip and handicapping but others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: In the frame in 6f AW nurseries on last three starts; stamina has to be taken on trust
runners.name: King Victorious
runners.spotlight: In the frame in AW nurseries on his last three starts; they were over 6f and his stamina for this extended mile has to be taken on trust.

13:45.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well beaten in both runs; no appeal
runners.name: Wingstar
runners.spotlight: Down the field on debut (for Johnny Murtagh) last March and again well beaten when 125-1 for her stable debut seven weeks ago; withdrawn having played up at the stalls last month.

runners.comment: Not shown enough in two runs to think he was the answer today
runners.name: Contemplation
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two runs last year, the latest over 1m on his AW debut 19 days ago; this is uncompetitive but he still needs more.

runners.comment: Dropped away in a C&D maiden on debut last month; bred to do much better in time
runners.name: Hunterian
runners.spotlight: 16-1, raced wide and dropped right away in the home straight in a C&D maiden four weeks ago; bred to do much better at some point.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two AW runs last month, including over C&D
runners.name: Jerseygeordie
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two AW runs last month, finishing behind a couple of reopposing rivals over C&D ten days ago.

runners.comment: Second in 7f AW nurseries on last three starts; sets a clear standard for rivals to aim at
runners.name: Sovereign Wealth
runners.spotlight: He has finished second in 7f AW nurseries on his last three starts; sets a clear standard for his rivals to aim at and this trip should be within range on pedigree; the one to beat.

runners.comment: Second run better than his debut; more to come but perhaps over longer trips
runners.name: Von Dutch
runners.spotlight: Fetched 325,000gns as a yearling; modest form in two starts this winter, albeit his latest C&D fifth offered hope of better at some point; such progress may come when handicapping over further though.

runners.comment: Modest form in two runs here last month; improvement essential
runners.name: Wedonttellthetruth
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two runs here last month; improvement essential if he is to trouble the principals.

14:15.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: 2-2 here this winter; penalised but in form and on the up; leading contender
runners.name: Midnight Call
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return from a four-month break over C&D in November (form worked out well) and she followed up in a 5f classified event on Friday; has a 5lb penalty to shoulder but as an in-form and progressive mare she has to be taken seriously.

runners.breeder: Manister House N Anderton & P Leonard
runners.comment: Better than the bare figures at Newcastle last month; respected
runners.name: Catherine Chroi
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner; not found her best in her latest spell with Iain Jardine but she went off too hard in a 7f handicap at Newcastle last month, fading into fifth (strong form); respected.

runners.comment: Two course wins for Kevin Ryan last winter; no comparable form for new yard
runners.name: Causin A Commotion
runners.spotlight: Two course wins (5f/6f) for Kevin Ryan last winter; struggled in four runs for new stable and others bring more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Not beaten far over 5f here two weeks ago; others are still far more persuasive
runners.name: Coast
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far over 5f here two weeks ago and this trip will suit better; others come here with more obvious claims though.

runners.comment: C&D winner last month; not so good over 5f last time but dangerous if back to her best
runners.name: Lady Bouquet
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a C&D handicap last month; not in the same form over 5f two weeks later; a return to her best would see her in the shake up.

runners.comment: C&D winner; fair 3rd in November; less good latest but down in grade & can't be discounted
runners.name: Mintana
runners.spotlight: One of her five wins came over C&D and she ran well here on her penultimate start; not so good at Kempton since but she drops into 0-50 company and she was successful on the last occasion she raced at this level.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and ran okay here last month; needs more to defy another wide stall
runners.name: Piperstown
runners.spotlight: Won four times last winter, including twice over C&D; last month's return from a nine-week break was respectable but he will need to raise his game to defy another wide stall.

runners.comment: Struggled since his C&D second last September; others look safer
runners.name: Red Walls
runners.spotlight: Ten-time winner; second over C&D last September but it has been tough going since and others look safer.

runners.comment: Near miss in a 6f handicap at Southwell on Sunday (well backed); obvious chance
runners.name: Secret Road
runners.spotlight: Good mark on old form; low-key 5f run here on stable debut last month but went close to rewarding market support at Southwell on Sunday (6f), narrowly failing to peg back a more prominently ridden rival; major player.

runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders at present and easy enough to look elsewhere
runners.name: Sisters In The Sky
runners.spotlight: Won at Bath last summer (5.7f, firm) but more modest runs than good since; others are stronger.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Midfield finish behind Lady Bouquet here last month; others appeal more for the win
runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.spotlight: Midfield finish behind Lady Bouquet here last month on his first run since rejoining Shaun Harris; others look stronger for win purposes.

14:45.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Won a division of this race last year; quiet this winter but now the blinkers return.
runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.spotlight: Won a division of this race 12 months ago; not at her best in three runs this winter but the return of blinkers points to a much better performance today.

runners.comment: C&D hat-trick last January (including this race); not in much form this winter though
runners.name: Back Tomorrow
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.spotlight: Won a division of this race 12 months ago and went on to complete a hat-trick; quiet this time around, however, including on last two starts when blinkers returned; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Return to 6f an obvious plus, as is the drop into a 0-50; key player
runners.name: Beauzon
runners.spotlight: Prolific C&D winner; on a losing run but his last four runs have come over 7f and 5f and now reverts to his optimum trip, while also sneaking into a 0-50; key player.

runners.comment: Drops in grade and has a change of headgear so can't be discounted
runners.name: East Tyrone
runners.owner: Alan And David Fairhurst And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: He hasn't been running badly for his new yard and this is a drop in grade; blinkers the headgear of choice this time.

runners.comment: Two 5f wins here but still to prove she wants this far; others are much more appealing
runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.spotlight: Two 5f wins here but still to prove she wants this far; others are much more appealing.

runners.comment: 12-race maiden; ran okay over C&D in November but others are much more appealing
runners.name: Genius Mistake
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but she didn't run badly over C&D in November; not so good over 5f four weeks ago; others are much stronger.

runners.comment: Not at his best in the summer and up against it once again
runners.name: Oldbury Lad
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden; not at his best in the summer and up against it once again.

runners.comment: Struggling of late and easy enough to look elsewhere; blinkers are now added
runners.name: Poet
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on his last two starts; best efforts last year give him a squeak but this looks a fair race of its type and likely vulnerable; blinkers now tried (well held in cheekpieces in the past).

runners.comment: Form dipped at Kempton last time; better drawn today but others are still more appealing
runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.spotlight: Threatening prior to a disappointing effort at Kempton four weeks ago; better drawn today but others look stronger for win purposes.

runners.comment: Sharper for last month's stable debut; one to consider
runners.name: Triple Charged
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden but his best form makes him of some interest at this level; got messed about a bit in the early stages of a C&D handicap on his stable debut last month and ended up well beaten; that was his first run for five months though and no surprise to see a better run today with the promising Donagh Murphy taking off 7lb.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden who looks up against it once again
runners.name: Twilight Poppy
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden who looks up against it once again.

runners.comment: 0-6 in Ireland but ran out a ready winner on stable debut (6f) last month; more to come
runners.name: Baker Blue
runners.owner: Ms L Mars & Mrs A Brereton
runners.spotlight: 0-6 for Jessica Harrington in Ireland but he made a winning start for Dylan Cunha when making all in a 6f novice at Southwell 19 days ago; more required back in a handicap but foolish to rule out further progress.

runners.comment: Two 6f wins for Adrian Keatley last year; fair mark now starting out for Karl Burke
runners.name: Better And Better
runners.spotlight: Two 6f turf wins for Adrian Keatley as a 2yo; flopped on heavy ground at Doncaster when last seen in November (wore cheekpieces which are absent today) and now makes his debut for Karl Burke; interesting contender.

runners.breeder: New England Stud A Nicoll & P Vela
runners.comment: Progressed with each run as a 2yo, winning cosily at Newcastle in September; unexposed
runners.name: Augustus Gloop
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of his three runs in novice/maiden company, getting off the mark in a four-runner event at Newcastle 100 days ago (6f); open to further progress and he's a leading contender for a stable who do well with this type.

runners.comment: Followed Brighton maiden win with good 2nd in a Doncaster nursery; more to come; AW debut
runners.name: Magic Stone
runners.spotlight: Won a Brighton maiden (6f, good to firm) last August and followed that with a good second of 15 at Doncaster one month later; 2lb rise fair enough and he remains capable of better.

runners.comment: Well held in Listed company after winning a Ripon maiden last summer; yard/AW/h'cap debut
runners.name: Duskaura
runners.spotlight: Highly tried after winning a 5f fillies' maiden at Ripon last summer and came up shy in Listed company; sold for £21,000 last August; makes her stable/handicap/AW debut in a warm race and perhaps best watched.

runners.comment: Two solid runs for new yard last month; shouldn't be far away once more
runners.name: Victor Cee
runners.spotlight: Turf winner (6f, good) for Karl Burke last summer; two solid runs for his new stable last month; shouldn't be too far away once again.

runners.comment: Won small-field maiden at Bath on debut; highly tried after & came up short; others safer
runners.name: Saffron Dandy
runners.spotlight: Odds-on when beating three rivals at Bath on her debut last May (5f, firm); struggled in a Group 3 and a York sales race in two runs afterwards; others look better handicapped ahead of her return.

15:45.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Julien & Mme Regula Vanno
runners.comment: Kempton win was a fine effort but hasn't backed it up in 2 runs since; capable on his day
runners.name: Society Man
runners.spotlight: Saw off 13 rivals, including Follow Your Heart, when winning a 7f handicap at Kempton last October; not so good twice since but returning to 7f will help and he can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Not easy to win with nowadays and minor money perhaps his best hope
runners.name: Diamondonthehill
runners.spotlight: Not easy to win with nowadays and although he has run some sound races this winter, others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: 6th course win when leading late over C&D last month; 2lb rise shouldn't prevent a big run
runners.name: Follow Your Heart
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of a never-dangerous seventh at Kempton when keeping on well to win a C&D handicap 17 days ago; that took his course record to six wins from 16 visits (also second four times) and he's a leading candidate despite a 2lb nudge.

runners.comment: Easy C&D win in a lower grade in November; beaten off this mark three times since
runners.name: Al Muqdad
runners.spotlight: Easily won a C&D handicap (Class 5) in November; beaten off this mark three times since and perhaps vulnerable once again.

runners.comment: C&D winner; solid effort when 4th to Follow Your Heart here 17 days ago; respected
runners.name: Thurso
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, the latest coming over C&D in October; 2l behind Follow Your Heart when fourth over C&D 17 days ago; each-way claims.

runners.breeder: Ringfort Stud Ltd & M&p Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: 0-7 but has shown promise; gelded since latest start; dangerous mark if back to his best
runners.name: Echalar
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden with a patchy record; of interest on his best form though and a gelding operation since last seen could have a positive effect.

runners.comment: On a good mark on 2025 best but he ended the year quietly; not a solid option
runners.name: The Turpinator
runners.spotlight: 6f Tapeta win last April and followed that with a good third at Chester's May meeting; he has struggled since but he is now down in the weights and a seven-week break may have freshened him up.

runners.breeder: North Cheshire Trading And Storage Ltd
runners.comment: C&D winner; promising run last month but Saturday's Southwell effort wasn't so good
runners.name: Grabajabba
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in December 2024; three runs after a seven-month break this winter, the best of them when third of 12 at Chelmsford last month; not so good over 1m on Saturday but he won't mind dropping back in distance and can't be discounted.

16:15.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Placed on his last two starts, latest when second of nine at Southwell nine days ago.
runners.name: Bashful Boy
runners.spotlight: A dual purpose performer, he is well treated on his best form but his last win was in 2023; placed on his last two starts, latest when second of nine at Southwell (2m) nine days ago; takes a drop in class and should go close.

runners.comment: Led until inside the final furlong when second of eight here last Tuesday.
runners.name: Circuit Breaker
runners.spotlight: Hasn't fulfilled earlier expectations but came close to taking advantage of a drop in class when leading until inside the final furlong and second of eight here (1m6f) last Tuesday; the longer trip is in his favour and he should go well.

runners.comment: Won here for previous trainer in October; has run three solid races for new trainer since.
runners.name: Appier
runners.spotlight: Won here (1m6f) on his final start for Sean Woods in October off 2lb lower mark; has run three solid races for new trainer since but has yet to win beyond 1m6f and needs to find a bit more.

runners.comment: Ran below form in a couple of contests at Newcastle last month following a break.
runners.name: Zephlyn
runners.spotlight: Landed a couple of Catterick handicaps over 2m in May but ran below form in a couple of contests at Newcastle last month following a break; best watched until he shows more.

runners.comment: Not seen on Flat since finishing last of seven here last January.
runners.name: Hill Station
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Stratford in September; not seen on Flat since finishing last of seven at Southwell (1m6f) last January; last Flat win came in April 2024 and he has yet to win beyond 1m4f in this sphere; best watched unless there is a market move.

runners.comment: Has found steady improvement on AW since stepping up in trip for this yard.
runners.name: Fascinating Shadow
runners.spotlight: Has found steady improvement on AW since stepping up in trip for this yard, winning at Lingfield (2m) last month; runner-up twice since, latest at Southwell (2m) on Saturday; looks sure to go close.

16:45.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Landed his third course win last Tuesday when running out a comfortable winner
runners.name: First Greyed
runners.spotlight: Landed his third course win last Tuesday when running out a comfortable winner; incurs a 4lb penalty but that should not prevent him from going close in his follow up bid.

runners.comment: Won three times in the first half of the year but has gone off the boil recently
runners.name: Antiquity
runners.owner: P&h Moorhead J Collins And S Piper
runners.spotlight: Won three times in the first half of the year but has gone off the boil and was below his best in two races at Kempton last month; needs to show improvement to figure.

runners.comment: Sole success came in a 6f novice in September 2024; continues to drop in the weights
runners.name: Apache Green
runners.spotlight: Sole success came in a 6f turf novice in September 2024 when trained by William Haggas; has continued to drop in the weights for current yard this year and application of headgear has not stemmed the tide.

runners.comment: Can blow hot and cold, although he has been runner-up three times in his last six starts
runners.name: Super Hit
runners.spotlight: Can blow hot and cold; has been runner-up three times in his last six starts but the losing run is accumulating and he is not one to place maximum faith in.

runners.comment: 0-15 on AW and needs to do better than when last on stable debut over C&D 15 days ago
runners.name: Coolree
runners.spotlight: 0-15 on AW and needs to do better than when last of eight on stable debut over C&D 15 days ago.

runners.comment: Got off the mark on AW at Southwell last month and got up close home here on Friday
runners.name: Latin
runners.spotlight: Consistent since joining this yard in the spring, only failing to make the frame once from 12 starts; off the mark at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last month and got up close home here (9.5f) on Friday; hold-up performer who carries a 5lb penalty and needs things to drop right again but should go close.

runners.comment: Back from a break he ran his best race to date when beaten a neck over C&D last month
runners.name: Yehudi
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; returned from a break with his best effort to date when beaten a neck over C&D last month; holds claims if he can reproduce that.

runners.comment: Well held over C&D when returning from a break last month and needs to raise his game
runners.name: Pessoa
runners.spotlight: All of his six wins have come at this track (7f/8.6f); last success was in June but that was off 2lb lower; well held over C&D when returning from a short break last month and needs to raise his game.

runners.comment: Has beaten only one opponent in five starts since joining current yard
runners.name: Rogue Soldier
runners.spotlight: Has beaten only one rival in five starts since joining current yard and cannot be recommended.

runners.breeder: Haras DLa Riviere Mme Liza Judd
runners.comment: Got off the mark at Southwell in October on just her second handicap start
runners.name: Quite Sweet
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Southwell (1m) in October on just her second handicap start; failed to build on that when running on Polytrack at Lingfield (1m) last month, but this lightly raced filly may still have more to offer back on Tapeta.

17:15.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Both AW wins came over C&D at the end of 2024; has made the frame on his last two starts.
runners.name: Bass Player
runners.spotlight: Both handicap wins came over C&D at the end of 2024; has made the frame on his last two starts, both here, the latest when fourth of ten (7f) ten days ago; should be competitive back at his winning trip.

runners.comment: Got off the mark at the 11th attempt, over C&D in October when trained by Roger Varian.
runners.name: Suzuka
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 11th attempt, over C&D in October when trained by Roger Varian; subsequently sold for 16,000gns; market may be best guide to her chance of following up on stable debut.

runners.comment: Held in eight starts since sole success and is still 3lb higher.
runners.name: Token Gesture
runners.spotlight: Scored at Kempton in September 2024 but held in eight starts since and is still 3lb higher than his winning mark; needs to come down the weights.

runners.comment: Failed to take advantage of drop in class when a beaten favourite over C&D last month.
runners.name: Corundum
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs A E Pakenham
runners.spotlight: 0-13 and is not progressing; failed to take advantage of drop in class when a beaten favourite over C&D last month; down to a career-low mark but difficult to have too much faith in.

runners.comment: Nearly took advantage of a sliding mark when beaten a short head over C&D 15 days ago.
runners.name: Equion
runners.spotlight: 1-17 on AW but nearly took advantage of a sliding mark when beaten a short head over C&D 15 days ago; holds claims if able to reproduce that effort.

runners.comment: All four AW wins have came over C&D, the latest 24 days ago.
runners.name: King Of Speed
runners.spotlight: All four AW wins have came over C&D, the latest 24 days ago; back up in the weights but should not be far away.

runners.comment: Proved resurgent over C&D last time and remains 8lb below last winning mark.
runners.name: Fools Rush In
runners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: Had been out of sorts but proved resurgent when fourth of 11, amid traffic issues, over C&D ten days ago; remains 8lb below last winning mark and has to be of interest granted a clear run.

runners.comment: 0-6 but showed promise when second on his handicap debut at Southwell last January.
runners.name: Lightningboltzoom
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but showed promise when second on his handicap debut at Southwell (1m3f) last January; failed to build on that in two subsequent starts; has left the recently retired Paul Attwater and makes his debut for rookie trainer; still unexposed and worth keeping an eye on.

runners.comment: 1m1f Flat winner in Ireland in August 2024 and now rated 13lb lower.
runners.name: Mooretown Lad
runners.spotlight: 1m1f Flat winner in Ireland in August 2024 and now 13lb lower; nothing to enthuse about over hurdles or back on the Flat for John McConnell last year; in rear throughout on stable debut over C&D last month; easy to look elsewhere.

16:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: 1-3 over this C&D; now 1lb below his last winning mark; solid contender
runners.name: Castan
runners.spotlight: Best known for his Newcastle exploits (four wins) but is 1-3 over this C&D; solid effort when third of nine back at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) last month and is now 1lb below his last winning mark; solid contender.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper & Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Third over C&D last time, but was beaten over 5l and is 0-10 on the AW
runners.name: Glory Fighter
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has won ten times on turf but is 0-10 on the AW; fair third of nine over C&D last time and the winner has gone in again since, but he has nearly 2l to find with Popular Dream on that run; needs a bit more.

runners.comment: Promising fourth on AW debut at Newcastle in November, but took a step backwards next time
runners.name: Brazilian Belle
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner who made a promising AW debut when fourth of 12 at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) in November, but didn't build on it when seventh of nine back there last month; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: C&D winner, but finished behind two of these back at this venue 19 days ago
runners.name: Thankuappreciate
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in November 2024 and beaten a head back here in September, but finished behind two of these back at this venue 19 days ago; others make greater appeal.

runners.comment: Five wins here, but not very consistent and is still 6lb above her last winning mark
runners.name: Havechatma
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner here including four over this trip, the latest in September; got no run back here last month, but consistency isn't her strong suit and she remains 6lb higher than for that latest success.

runners.comment: C&D winner and 6lb below his last winning mark, but has become disappointing
runners.name: Winchurch
runners.owner: SBK Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who made a successful return from a break at Leicester (5f, good to firm) last summer; now 6lb lower, but with good reason and he finished behind three of these when beating one home back here last time.

runners.comment: 0-7; unexposed compared to her rivals but she may prefer a stiffer test
runners.name: Insuspense
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but has shown ability as when beaten 2l into fourth of nine on her return from 128 days off at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month; unexposed compared to her rivals, but she may prefer a slightly stiffer test than this.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner and second behind a subsequent winner last time; shortlisted
runners.name: Popular Dream
runners.spotlight: 3-14 over C&D and had three of these behind when chasing home a subsequent winner back here last time; has dropped another 1lb since and very much one for the shortlist.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Saint-Vincent & E A R
runners.comment: C&D winner; 2lb below last winning mark but not running well enough to take advantage
runners.name: Mersea
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has dropped 2lb lower than when winning at Musselburgh (5f, good) in August, but recent efforts raise serious doubts over whether she can take advantage.

runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner; off since last May but has a good record fresh; not easily dismissed
runners.name: Jeans Maite
runners.spotlight: Front-running veteran who has won five times over C&D and was last seen winning at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last May; has a good record fresh so can't be easily dismissed.

17:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: 1m2f turf win (classified) in August is the standout performance in her last nine starts
runners.name: Celebrating Ethel
runners.spotlight: 2-35 overall, with sole win for current yard in a 1m2f classified at Brighton in August; that's the standout performance in her last nine starts and, although effective on Wolverhampton Tapeta (unraced here) and having form over this far in her old Irish days, other options look more solid.

runners.comment: Sole win (24 races) was in 2024 and he's been underperforming since last May
runners.name: Cloud Free
runners.spotlight: Sole win (24 races) was in 2024 and he's been underperforming since last May; latest start (Newcastle 1m4f; second run since wind surgery) was probably his best show on Tapeta but he needs much better than that.

runners.comment: Sole win one year ago; not proven at quite this far and does not look the percentage call
runners.name: Desiderata
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 13 starts came in a classified event at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) one year ago on stable debut; refused to race once last March and below form on last three outings, absent 220 days before penultimate start; not proven over quite this far and does not look the percentage call.

runners.comment: No significant impact in his four Flat races and pulled up on recent hurdles/yard debut
runners.name: Destination Unkown
runners.spotlight: No significant impact in his four Flat races for Grant Tuer (best effort on debut) and pulled up on recent hurdles debut; no solid claims.

runners.comment: Scored three times in the first half of last year but has gone badly off the boil
runners.name: Khangai
runners.spotlight: Six career wins include two over 1m4f here; scored three times in the first half of last year but has gone badly off the boil this autumn/winter; this is his second run for this yard.

runners.comment: 0-26 but competitive in recent starts, including over C&D
runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.spotlight: 0-26 but competitive in recent starts; runner-up in two of his three in December, including over C&D nine days ago when leading at halfway and clear for most of the straight; third here on Sunday and has each-way claims again.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish; showed enough on debut for new yard to be given a second look
runners.name: Lady Delila
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent maiden in Ireland, modest at best; showed enough at Newcastle (1m; first-time hood) five weeks ago on debut for new yard to be given a second look here, although she's not raced over quite this far.

runners.comment: Six-time winner (four on Wolverhampton Tapeta); recent handicap results do not augur well
runners.name: Lawmans Blis
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner (four times on Wolverhampton Tapeta) who showed some spark last June but recent handicap results do not augur well; no Flat win since April 2024 but he did win a hurdle race last March.

runners.breeder: S Clarke G Parsons & A Wideson
runners.comment: Placed several times on turf last year; 1m4f form here penultimate start gives her a shot
runners.name: Stintino Sunset
runners.spotlight: No win since September 2024 but placed several times on turf last year and even her 1m4f form here on penultimate start gives her a shot in this weak classified contest.

runners.comment: 0-8 and not proven beyond 9.4f but her latest performance looked promising
runners.name: Good Shot
runners.spotlight: 0-8; went close on handicap debut at Lingfield (1m1f, good) in July and back to form when second under Charlie Tucker in a Wolverhampton handicap (9.4f, Tapeta) six weeks ago on latest start; a hood (tried on debut) returns; not proven beyond 9.4f but that latest performance (20-1; not getting the best of runs) gives her a form chance and contained encouragement.

runners.comment: 11-race maiden; absent 142 days before latest start; unraced beyond 7f; lots to prove
runners.name: Sharp Call
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who showed that a little ability remained on one occasion last June; absent 142 days before below form in first-time blinkers three weeks ago; that was over 6f and she's unraced beyond 7f; lots to prove.

runners.comment: Not bred for this far; hugely unexposed compared to most of today's rivals; drops in class
runners.name: Wadacre Moriarty
runners.spotlight: Beaten 12l on debut (last January) and about twice that far when next seen for two races this winter, all over 1m; not bred for this far but he's hugely unexposed compared to most of today's rivals and this race offers him a far more realistic chance.

17:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: 0-21, by a stamina influence but rarely seen at 1m2f+; latest instance did not work out
runners.name: Ciara Storm
runners.spotlight: 21-race maiden who is by a stamina influence but rarely seen at 1m2f+; latest instance was three starts back (a rare turf run) which didn't work out and she's since been rather worse back at 1m here; unpersuasive.

runners.comment: Both wins on Lingfield AW in 2022; 547 days off before fourth of eight three weeks ago
runners.name: Come To Pass
runners.spotlight: Both wins were over 1m2f on Lingfield AW in late 2022; 547 days off before his fourth of eight in a 1m4f handicap there three weeks ago, making most; needs much better than that but the run may have helped him fitness-wise.

runners.comment: In good form on turf in August/September; below form since and has a 1-29 score on AW
runners.name: Foinix
runners.owner: M Robinson Jack Pook & Jeanette May
runners.spotlight: In good form on turf in August/September; struggled in three hurdle runs since and below form returned to AW at Lingfield three weeks ago; with his 1-29 score on AW, there seem to be safer options elsewhere.

runners.comment: 0-22 on Flat and 0-4 over hurdles; second on Newcastle Tapeta last March; off since June
runners.name: Hijo De La Luna
runners.spotlight: 0-22 on Flat and 0-4 over hurdles; second on Newcastle Tapeta (1m2f handicap) last March and third of six in a Southwell maiden hurdle (2m, good) in May, but two poor shows in June; fair bit to prove on first run since.

runners.comment: Maiden after 14 starts and beaten 6l or more in his last eight runs; ran poorly latest
runners.name: Muhib
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 14 starts and beaten 6l or more in his last eight runs; finished last on his only appearance here and ran poorly on last month's latest start, so it's not hard to turn elsewhere.

runners.comment: Has frame possibilities on plenty of form; however, he also has a 0-30 win record
runners.name: Rampant
runners.spotlight: Has frame possibilities on plenty of form, including over C&D as recently as four starts ago; however, he also has a 0-30 win record.

runners.comment: Only midfield in three handicaps returned to this sphere since joining new stable
runners.name: The Pug
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in 2023; sole win since was over 1m2f in August in his last turf attempt; effective on AW but only midfield in three handicaps returned to this sphere since joining new stable; needs to raise his game.

runners.comment: Well treated on best 2025 form but is becoming increasingly unreliable
runners.name: Broadstone
runners.spotlight: Well treated on best 2025 form but is becoming increasingly unreliable, regularly blowing the start; reluctant to race on penultimate outing.

runners.comment: Best taking minor honours in two of his four handicaps, including over 1m4f here on latest
runners.name: Highfield Comrade
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden; best efforts taking minor honours in two of his four handicaps, including over 1m4f here on latest; player.

runners.comment: 0-12; not disgraced over 1m3f/1m4f on last two outings; each-way chance
runners.name: Ignition
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden, with the last three for new yard; best form on AW, including here, and not disgraced over 1m3f/1m4f on last two outings; each-way chance.

runners.comment: 16 runs and no win but he has enough ability to be considered; off since August; new yard
runners.name: Jack Andrea
runners.owner: J Rayment J Stephenson & R Eddery
runners.spotlight: 16 runs and still no win but he has enough ability to be considered in this line-up; off since August and unraced beyond 1m2f, so there's something to be proved on this first run since leaving Robert Eddery (who's still a part-owner) but he needs a second look.

runners.comment: 0-9 overall; form claims but not from his last three outings and headgear is now removed
runners.name: West Wickham
runners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock & Steel A Win
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow in his three starts for new stable (1m6f/1m2f) and now 0-9 overall; has form claims but not from those last three outings and headgear is now removed.

18:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Won this last year and again here last month; creditable 3rd latest; should run well again
runners.name: Caramay
runners.spotlight: Started 2025 with two wins, including in this race, and also registered a smooth win at Southwell (1m4f) last month; creditable third at Wolverhampton 15 days ago and, having racked up such a solid sequence in the early months of last year, another big run should be on its way.

runners.comment: Won well on handicap debut (1m4f, turf) in June; backward steps in her only two runs since
runners.name: Thankyou Baroness
runners.spotlight: Won well on handicap debut at Doncaster (upped to 1m4f) in June but backward steps in her only two starts since, the latest in September; career started with two runs on AW (5l defeats); chance if back to her best.

runners.comment: Dual Tapeta winner; inconsistent and other options look more solid
runners.name: Alpine Oasis
runners.spotlight: Dual Tapeta winner for Karl Burke, latterly over 1m4f here in December 2024 (off 1lb higher than today); inconsistent since and, after two runs for current yard, other options look more solid.

runners.breeder: J Cypres N Cypres & Earl Ecurie D
runners.comment: Dual French 1m4f AW winner last winter; latest run was major step back in right direction
runners.name: Lilly Lux
runners.spotlight: Dual French 1m4f AW winner last winter; tailed off on first two starts for this yard but her third of eight at 100-1 behind a runaway winner at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) six weeks ago was a major step back in the right direction.

runners.comment: 2nd and 1st in two 1m runs on Kempton AW early last year; should relish this longer trip
runners.name: Selenic
runners.owner: Sir F Brooke & Sir R Pilkington
runners.spotlight: Went down by a head at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) on debut last January and won a novice over that same C&D in February by the same margin; off since but she should relish the longer trip on this handicap debut and could still have lots of potential; market may be helpful but she's of major interest.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De La Mercerie F & P Ga
runners.comment: C&D win in October; good fourth of 11 at Kempton five weeks ago; in serious calculations
runners.name: Romantic Spirit
runners.spotlight: Four wins on Tapeta last year, the latest over C&D in October (made all in small field); good fourth of 11 at Kempton five weeks ago confirms her place in serious calculations.

runners.comment: Far more consistency on last four starts; 1m2f second on latest gives some hope for 1m3f
runners.name: Live Each Day
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f here in April on handicap debut; has found far more consistency in her last four outings, including a 1m win at Kempton in September and second over 1m2f at Chelmsford on latest start; the latter offers some hope for this extra 1f.

runners.comment: Reverts to just the hood and should be seriously involved if straight back to her best
runners.name: Little Miss India
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in cosy fashion in C&D handicap in October when hooded first time; placed on next two outings but last of five when cheekpieces joined the hood on latest; reverts to just the hood and should be seriously involved if straight back to her best.

18:30.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Record since switched to handicaps on Tapeta reads 33133; cheekpieces on; high on list
runners.name: R P McMurphy
runners.spotlight: Record since switched to handicaps on Tapeta reads 33133 and was only beaten two necks into third of 11 behind Charlatan at Wolverhampton (8.6f) ten days ago; 2lb better off and high on the list with cheekpieces now given a go.

runners.comment: Rarely seen on Tapeta, but is now 3lb below his last winning mark; worth a second look
runners.name: The Spotlight Kid
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner including twice on Polytrack; rarely seen on Tapeta, but is now 3lb below his last winning mark; worth a second look.

runners.comment: Beat a subsequent winner by a nose at Newcastle three weeks ago; each-way claims
runners.name: Showmedemoney
runners.spotlight: Can make the running; dual winner at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta), the latest in first time blinkers when beating a subsequent winner by a nose three weeks ago; only 2lb higher and holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: Course regular who has won five times over 7f/1m here; one for the shortlist
runners.name: Back From Dubai
runners.spotlight: Handy sort and course regular who has won five times over 7f/1m here; only beaten half a length into third of nine at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) 11 days ago (runner-up has won since) and one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: 3lb higher than when taking this last year; won at Wolverhampton last time; go well again
runners.name: Charlatan
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer; was winning his first race since landing this contest off 3lb lower last year when scoring by a neck at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) ten days ago; should go well again with the race likely to be run to suit.

runners.comment: Well held in all four starts; makes little appeal
runners.name: Pride Eye
runners.spotlight: Well held in all four starts, including when behind two of these on handicap debut at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) three weeks ago; tongue-tie returns but she makes little appeal.

runners.comment: All five wins over 7f, but he has run well over 1m and is back off his last winning mark
runners.name: Ring Of Gold
runners.spotlight: All five wins have come over 7f on the AW, but he has run well over this far and is back off his last winning mark; no surprise if he figures.

runners.comment: 0-16 and has a bit to find with Showmedemoney on recent Newcastle running
runners.name: Space Raider
runners.owner: Royale Racing & Alfa Site Services Ltd
runners.spotlight: 0-16 and has over 4l to find with Showmedemoney on Newcastle running (1m, Tapeta; first-time cheekpieces) three weeks ago; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner; ran well on his return in October, but regressed next time
runners.name: Masham Moor
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins have come over C&D and he made an encouraging return when fourth of ten back here in October, but a tame effort the following month leaves him with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Has gained two of his three wins over C&D, but recent efforts will need improving upon
runners.name: Mickey Mongoose
runners.spotlight: Often a front-runner; has gained two of his three wins over C&D, but recent efforts will need improving upon.

19:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Patchy form since making a successful handicap debut last summer; up in trip
runners.name: Amarachi
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since making a successful handicap debut at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) last summer and the drop to this level didn't result in any improvement at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) 15 days ago; needs the longer trip to make a difference.

runners.comment: Unplaced in five starts; drop in trip may help; visor on
runners.name: Showstorm
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in five starts, but did too much early in first-time cheekpieces at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) 17 days ago; more needed, but the drop in trip may help and a visor is now given a go.

runners.comment: C&D winner last year; market useful back from six months off
runners.name: Brinton
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins last year (including over C&D) came in 0-50 classified events, though she did win a 0-60 handicap at Brighton (1m, good) in May; market useful back from six months off.

runners.comment: Tapeta record reads 493778409 so he does have something to prove back from 75 days off
runners.name: Kessaar Power
runners.spotlight: Handy sort whose three AW wins have all come at Chelmsford; Tapeta record reads 493778409 so he does have something to prove back from 75 days off.

runners.breeder: Highpark B/Stock Ltd & Akuna B/Stock Ltd
runners.comment: 0-21 but placed in six of her last seven completed starts; ought to be right there
runners.name: Imola
runners.spotlight: 0-21 but placed in six of her last seven completed starts including when second of ten here (7f) on Saturday; return to this trip should suit and she ought to be right there.

runners.comment: Well held in six starts including two here at the weekend; best watched
runners.name: Summer Evening
runners.spotlight: Well held in six starts including two over 6f/7f here at the weekend; best watched.

runners.comment: Mainly seen on Polytrack; ran okay over C&D in October, but needs a bit more
runners.name: Poke The Bear
runners.spotlight: Mainly seen on Polytrack including his sole success at Lingfield (1m) last month; ran okay when fourth of ten over C&D in October, but needs a bit more.

runners.comment: 0-11 and well beaten on stable debut four weeks ago
runners.name: Pave The Way
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who finished runner up on a couple of occasions for Eve Johnston Houghton, but needs a good deal more than on her low-key stable debut at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) four weeks ago.

runners.comment: 0-21, but didn't enjoy the smoothest of trips last time; not written off on her best form
runners.name: Saved Lizzie
runners.spotlight: 0-21, but didn't enjoy the smoothest of trips on her second start for the yard here (7f) 19 days ago; not written off on her best form.

19:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (horses In Bands C/D) (GBB)

runners.comment: Something to like on pedigree but stable not noted for winners first time out
runners.name: Macs Wee Sister
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 5f/6f winner Wee Fat Mac (including AW; RPR 76), half-sister to five winners including Sound Advice (7f-1m including 2yo/AW; 108), Home Before Dusk (1m-1m2f AW; 102) and Archies Advice (1m-1m2f including AW; 84); dam 6f-1m winner (71); something to like on pedigree, but she makes a belated debut and stable not noted for winners first time out.

runners.comment: Last of eight on her Wolverhampton debut last summer; little appeal
runners.name: Trouble In Chicago
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and always behind when last of eight on her Wolverhampton debut (7f, Tapeta) last summer; makes little appeal.

runners.breeder: Ballybin Stud Ltd & Patrick F Kelly
runners.comment: Third in a Deauville Listed event last summer; fascinating contender on return
runners.name: Ellusive Butterfly
runners.spotlight: Green when fourth of six on her Ripon debut (6f, good) in June last year, but ran well in the face of a stiff task when third of six in a Deauville Listed event (7f, soft) 17 days later (form franked by the winner); half-brother and dam won on the AW; fascinating contender.

runners.comment: Stable can get them ready first time and worth a market check
runners.name: Seapearl
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns foal, 30,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 6.6f 2yo winner (RPR 75), closely related to 7f 2yo winner Royal County Down, half-sister to winners Graymalkin (1m-1m2f including 2yo) and Airglow (5f/6f), out of 6f 2yo Listed winner; stable can get them ready first time and worth a market check.

runners.comment: Well beaten in one start for Alice Haynes; best watched on stable debut
runners.name: Blue Celestial
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when a well-beaten ninth of 11 in one start for Alice Haynes at Bath (1m, soft) in October; probably best watched on stable debut (same owners) unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts at Wolverhampton last month; major player
runners.name: Seeing Stars
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in both starts at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month and may have been up against a nice newcomer when turned over at 4-5 on the second occasion; major player.

runners.comment: Probably only of interest if attracting support on debut
runners.name: Star Suepreme
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to 1m3f winner La Hulotte, out of maiden half-sister to French 1m2f Group 1 winners Vadawina and Vazira; probably only of interest if attracting support on her debut.

20:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Consistent since contesting Polytrack handicaps; latest 3rd at Chelmsford has been franked
runners.name: Flash Rascal
runners.spotlight: Consistent since contesting Polytrack handicaps (133) and his latest third of nine at Chelmsford (7f) has since been franked by the runner-up; shouldn't be inconvenienced by the return to 6f and hold each-way claims once again.

runners.comment: Pulling too hard has compromised her chances in all three starts since her winning debut
runners.name: Space Bear
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive2 & Jonny Allison
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last summer, but pulling too hard has compromised her chances in all three starts since; best watched for now.

runners.comment: 0-7 for Clive Cox last year; makes her stable debut after three months off; market helpful
runners.name: Country Artiste
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for Clive Cox last year, though twice finished runner-up on turf; makes her stable debut after three months off having changed hands for 19,000gns in October; market helpful.

runners.comment: Ordinary form last summer, but her sire is 8-28 (29%) here in the past five seasons
runners.name: Berlinetta
runners.spotlight: 260,000gns yearling; ordinary form in three starts on turf last summer, albeit the undulations of Chepstow found her out when third of seven there (5f, good to firm) on the final occasion; not seen in 140 days, but she is in good hands and her sire is 8-28 (29%) here in the past five seasons.

runners.comment: Runner-up in three starts last year including two at Wolverhampton; shouldn't be far away
runners.name: Shes Divine
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in all three starts last year including two at Wolverhampton, the latest after six months off (5f) 11 days ago; shouldn't be far away once more.

runners.comment: Promise in her first three start, but was a disappointing last of three on nursery debut
runners.name: Nalas Dream
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Promise in her first three starts last year, including when beaten half a length in a Wolverhampton novice (6f, Tapeta) in October, but was a disappointing last of three on nursery debut at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) last time; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Won here on Thursday and Saturday; should be hard to beat despite double penalty
runners.name: Dartrey
runners.spotlight: 750,000euros half-brother to Saffron Beach (7f/1m including 2yo/Group 1; RPR 121); has suddenly taken off in handicaps around here this year, winning easily over 6f on New Year's Day (6f) and over 7f on Saturday; has a double penalty to carry, but he still should be hard to beat.

runners.comment: Fourth in both handicaps, not beaten far at Newcastle last time, but still needs more
runners.name: Mystical Land
runners.spotlight: Fourth in both handicaps, not beaten far dropped to 5f at Newcastle three weeks ago, but still needs a bit more.

20:30.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Won over 5f here in October; drops in grade and could play a part if his stamina holds out
runners.name: Lovat Scout
runners.owner: D J Mackay & West Shaw Farm
runners.spotlight: Won over this trip on his 2yo debut but his best efforts since have come over 5f, as when winning under Jack Nicholls here in November; drops in grade and could play a part if his stamina holds out.

runners.comment: Became disappointing last year and made little impression over C&D 18 days ago
runners.name: Phoenix Of Dreams
runners.spotlight: Mainly consistent as a 2yo, but became disappointing last year and made little impression back from wind surgery over C&D 18 days ago; needs a resurgence in the returning hood.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner and just 1lb higher than when last successful; could play a part
runners.name: Blackjack
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has won three times over C&D and is just 1lb higher than when last successful; could play a part if producing something like his best form in the returning visor.

runners.comment: Has gradually regressed since winning over C&D in October; still 7lb higher
runners.name: Massimo Blue
runners.spotlight: Both wins on the AW last year, but has gradually regressed since winning over C&D in October; still 7lb higher than for that success and plenty more will be needed.

runners.comment: Ability in three goes on the AW including when third over C&D 18 days ago; high on list
runners.name: I Need Your Love
runners.spotlight: Both wins at around 6f on turf, but has shown ability in just three goes on the AW including when beaten less than a length into third of eight over C&D 18 days ago; high on list from the same mark.

runners.breeder: Mayden Stud& Last Day Racing Partnership
runners.comment: Off 11 weeks and didn't run very well in one previous visit here
runners.name: Holbache
runners.spotlight: Winner of ten races including two at Kempton (6f, Polytrack); fair third of eight at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) in October, but off 11 weeks since and didn't run very well in one previous visit here.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all nine handicaps though beaten under 2l last time; needs to step up again
runners.name: Camera Shy
runners.owner: The Horse Watchers 13 And Michael Dods
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut for Michael Bell in May 2024; hasn't built on it and has finished unplaced in all nine handicaps including two for this yard, albeit he was beaten less than 2l into fourth of 11 over C&D (first-time tongue-tie) last month; needs to step up again.

runners.comment: Won at the Curragh last summer, but has regressed since; was behind two of these last time
runners.name: Saturn Seven
runners.spotlight: Three wins on turf in Ireland, the latest when beating 22 rivals at the Curragh (6.3f, good) last summer; has regressed since, though, and finished behind two of these on stable debut over C&D in November.

runners.comment: 3lb below his last winning mark and 5lb lower than when winning over C&D in November 2024
runners.name: Showtime Mahomes
runners.spotlight: Put some modest efforts behind him when fourth of 12 here last time (No Knee Never third); 3lb below his last winning mark and 5lb lower than when successful over C&D in November 2024; worth keeping an eye on.

runners.comment: Not at his best at Wolverhampton last time, but should appreciate the return to this trip
runners.name: No Knee Never
runners.spotlight: Not at his best at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) ten days ago, but had previously won there (6f; first-time cheekpieces) and finished a close third over this C&D; should appreciate the return to this trip and holds each-way claims.
